Package it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.InteractiveComponents

Class InteractiveComponent

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.Component
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.LiveComponent
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.InteractiveComponents.InteractiveComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
CardDrawer, CardMapZoom, CardPlacer, CardPoolZoom, CardStarterChoice, ChatMessageSender, ColorPicker, GameManualStarter, LobbyChooser, LobbyCreator, LobbyJoiner, LogInSignUp, PickSecretObjective, ServerConnectionWizard, Zoomer
public abstract class InteractiveComponent extends LiveComponent
Abstract class representing an interactive component in a text-based user interface (TUI). This class extends LiveComponent and manages user interactions involving multiple stages of input. It includes methods for handling input navigation back to previous menus or choices, managing input counters, and printing prompts for user interaction. Each subclass must implement methods to return keywords and descriptions for identification and user guidance. Subclasses define specific behaviors for handling user input and managing interaction flow, such as selecting options, placing cards, or navigating menus. The handleInput(String) method processes user inputs based on the current interaction stage and returns appropriate status codes to indicate completion, quitting, or incomplete input handling.

  • Constructor Details

    • InteractiveComponent

      public InteractiveComponent(int maxInputCounter)
      Constructs an interactive component with a specified maximum input counter. This counter determines the maximum stage of input processing the component will handle. After reaching this maximum input stage, further inputs are ignored until the counter is reset.
      Parameters:
      maxInputCounter - The maximum value of the input counter at which inputs will still be processed. Inputs beyond this counter are ignored until the counter is reset.

  • Method Details

    • handleInput

      public InteractiveComponentReturns handleInput(String input)
      Handles the user input for navigating back to the previous menu or choice. If the input is "/BACK", it decrements the input counter if it's greater than zero, indicating a successful navigation back, and returns InteractiveComponentReturns.COMPLETE. If the input counter is zero and "/BACK" is entered, it returns InteractiveComponentReturns.QUIT to signal the intent to quit or return to a higher-level menu. If the input is not "/BACK", the method returns InteractiveComponentReturns.INCOMPLETE.
      Parameters:
      input - The user input to process.
      Returns:
      InteractiveComponentReturns.COMPLETE if successfully navigated back, InteractiveComponentReturns.QUIT if at the top-level and intending to quit, InteractiveComponentReturns.INCOMPLETE otherwise.

    • getKeyword

      public abstract String getKeyword()
      Returns the keyword associated with this interactive component. The keyword is used to determine which component should handle the input when there are multiple interactive component in the same view state.
      Returns:
      The keyword associated with this interactive component.

    • getDescription

      public abstract String getDescription()
      Returns the description of this interactive component. The description can be used to communicate to the user the purpose or behavior of the component.
      Returns:
      The description of this interactive component.

    • getInputCounter

      public int getInputCounter()
      Retrieves the current input counter of this interactive component. The input counter tracks the current stage of user inputs being processed.
      Returns:
      The current input counter of this interactive component.

    • getMaxInputCounter

      public int getMaxInputCounter()
      Retrieves the maximum input counter value allowed for this interactive component. Inputs are processed only up to this maximum counter value.
      Returns:
      The maximum input counter value allowed for this interactive component.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints a message prompting the user to go back to the previous choice if applicable. This message is printed only when the input counter is within the valid range (greater than 0 and less than or equal to maxInputCounter). The message informs the user that they can type "/back" to return to the previous menu or choice.
      Specified by:
      print in class Component
